subject: Psychology
title: The Power of Cues
description: A quick win: understand The Power of Cues.

hook.text: You walk into the cinema and crave popcorn â€” even if you just ate. The theater is the cue, not hunger.

buildup.text: Cues are the triggers that launch a habit. They can be a location, time, emotional state, or preceding action.

discovery.text: Wendy Wood's research found that changing the environment â€” removing or altering cues â€” is key to changing habits.

twist.text: This is why people often break habits on vacation. New environment, no familiar cues, no automatic behavior.

climax.text: You don't need more willpower. You need fewer cues for bad habits and more cues for good ones.

punchline.text: Control the cues and you control the habit.
